result.execSummary:
The defendant Aimee Jo Marie Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aimee Jo Marie Smith

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty Larry Lloyd

10:50 AM Defendant Aimee Jo Marie Smith in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney (Atty) Larry J. Lloyd in court for Aimee Jo Marie Smith. 
Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 2 - No Contest

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read in.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present. 
ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Lloyd concurs with the joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT: 
$200 fine + costs and surcharges and domestic abuse assessment.
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Response to States Discovery Demand filed by Atty Larry Lloyd
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:21 PM Defendant Aimee Jo Marie Smith appeared in court, Attorney Larry J. Lloyd for Aimee Jo Marie Smith appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin, ADA Brian Pfeil, appeared in court. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for March 14, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1
No violent or abusive contact with J.H.

1:07 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah Dodge appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer and Disorderly Conduct - Domestic.
State has complied with victim rights notification.
1:10 p.m.  Victim is in court that would like to speak - victim makes statements to the Court.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.

State requests a $250 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 
Court will adopt the $250 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record.

Initial Appearance scheduled for:   March 14, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m.  in Branch 1
